medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The hip pain began approximately two weeks prior to the visit and was minimally responsive to nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs. The pain was limiting his ability to work at his normal level and was primarily localized to the lateral aspect of the hip. The pain continued to increase gradually, requiring intermittent narcotic pain medication, although he had no restrictions on weight-bearing.
medical_history.past_medical_history: During the current evaluation, the patient was concurrently being treated for acute renal colic following the passage of a renal coliculus two weeks previously. Additionally, he had several prior summertime jobs involving excavation and demolition work.
medical_history.social_history: The patient previously worked at a job in construction requiring heavy labor and lived in the Missouri River valley region. He was also heavily involved with turf and landscape management classes at school.
